parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: Your Application ID

parameters.name: botname
parameters.description: The name of the bot. Format required is 3-64 characters in length and only numbers or lower-case letters [0-9][a-z]

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: Message to be sent to the bot. This can contain multiple sentences. Currently the limit is 500 characters.

parameters.name: clientName
parameters.description: Leave blank to request Pandorabots to create a client_name which will support persistent predicates. Including a valid client_name in this parameter will work in the same way that Talk to Bot API but with persistent predicates. It is recommended to use this API only to create an end-user client_name, and then use normal Talk to Bot API to continue conversation with the bot.

parameters.name: sessionid
parameters.description: Session ID generated by Pandorabots. This allows the application to group individual conversations into a collection as needed. If not included in the call, Pandorabots will issue a new session ID. (4-byte integer type)

parameters.name: recent
parameters.description: If true, the system will not signal an error if the bot is uncompiled, and will instead look for a previous version of the bot that is available.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: Your Application ID

parameters.description: Your Application ID

parameters.name: botname
parameters.description: Name of the bot to delete.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: Your Application ID

parameters.name: botname
parameters.description: The name of the bot.

parameters.name: return
parameters.description: If set to zip, a zip file with all bot files will be returned.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: Your Application ID

parameters.name: botname
parameters.description: Must be unique from all the other bots you have created under this app_id. Can only be numbers and lowercase letters, and must be between 3 and 64 characters long.

methods.description: Delete a bot file (AIML, set, map, substitution)

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: Your Application ID

parameters.name: botname
parameters.description: Name of the bot.

parameters.name: fileKind
parameters.description: Specify the type of file being deleted: file (for AIML files), map, substitution, set

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Filename to delete. Note: for non-AIML files, do not include the file extension in the path.

methods.description: Retrieve a bot file (AIML, set, map, substitution)

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: Your Application ID

parameters.name: botname
parameters.description: Name of the bot.

parameters.name: fileKind
parameters.description: Specify the type of file being retrieved: file (for AIML files), map, substitution, set

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Filename to retrieve. Note: for non-AIML files, do not include the file extension in the path.

methods.description: Upload a bot file (AIML, set, substitution, map)

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: Your Application ID

parameters.name: botname
parameters.description: Your bot's name

parameters.name: fileKind
parameters.description: Specify the type of file being uploaded: file (for AIML files), map, substitution, set

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Filename to upload, must be named with only lowercase letters and numbers. Note: for non-AIML files, do not include the file extension in the path.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: Your Application ID

parameters.name: botname
parameters.description: The name of the bot. Format required is 3-64 characters in length and only numbers or lower-case letters [0-9][a-z]

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: Message to be sent to the bot. This can contain multiple sentences. Currently the limit is 500 characters.

parameters.name: clientName
parameters.description: Identifies your application's end user. You can assign each of your end users a unique client_name. This will allow you to set predicates and other variable information that is specific to an individual. Format required is 3-64 characters in length and only numbers or lower-case letters [0-9][a-z]

parameters.name: sessionid
parameters.description: Session ID generated by Pandorabots. This allows the application to group individual conversations into a collection. While testing your bot, not including this parameter, Pandorabots will issue a new session ID. (4-byte integer type)

parameters.name: that
parameters.description: For debugging purposes, you can specify a 'that' with the input that supersedes the existing that in bot memory.

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description: For debugging purposes, you can specify a 'topic' with the input that supersedes the existing topic in bot memory.

parameters.name: extra
parameters.description: Return extra conversation information. If true, input, pattern, that, topic, filename, and template associated with the pattern matched are returned in addition to response and sessionid.

parameters.name: reset
parameters.description: Reset the bot memory. If true, all predicate values in the bot will be discarded, and the user can talk to the bot as if it is the first time

parameters.name: trace
parameters.description: Include trace data in the response. If true, the system will generate AIML trace information for the input. Trace data includes pattern matched, filename, input, template for all recursion levels. NOTE: for security reasons, trace does not work with client_name.

parameters.name: reload
parameters.description: If true, the system will force a reload of the bot into memory. This can be useful if you've recently uploaded an AIML file, recompiled your bot and want access to your bot's latest changes.

parameters.name: recent
parameters.description: If true, the system will not signal an error if the bot is uncompiled, and will instead look for a previous version of the bot that is available.

apiDescription: AIaaS provides API access to our bot hosting platform and SDKs, allowing developers to easily integrate conversational interfaces into applications.
